cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for total rainfall, today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking first from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (201°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 73.44 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1546 m), light levels (up 3071 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 46.0m higher than yesterday, 437.0m lower than the past week, 1545.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1113.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
